meanings.definition: To cover with a new roof.
meanings.sent1: The old house was reroofed with shiny new tiles.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers reroofed the building after the storm damage.
meanings.sent3: The neighborhood was surprised when the cat reroofed its cardboard box with leaves.
meanings.sent4: Her smile reroofed the gloomy room with sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The sound of laughter reroofed the empty hall with joy.

meanings.sent1: The reroofed house looked fresh and sturdy.
meanings.sent2: The reroofed structure provided better insulation for the family.
meanings.sent3: The reroofed barn stood out among the old buildings in the area.
meanings.sent4: Her reroofed car sparkled under the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The reroofed gazebo offered a peaceful retreat in the garden.
